page.title: 07Farms
page.content: down because of Dutch Elm disease. Charity Farm was given to the Parish by a former Vicar -William Howerdley- in 1492,the income to be for the Parish poor and for Church repairs. Vicarage Farm next door was Church land. These two farms were bought by Greene King & Son Ltd. We were told that 15yrs ago 137 acres of woodland in Timworth Parish which abutts onto Livermere Road was bull- dozed and burnt to make more room for crops. This destroyed an annual display of Primroses,Oxslips,Purple Orchids and Bluebells. Some hedges have been taken out but this area is not yet like a prairie. Nix Green Farm has a spring.Elms Farm had a pond which has been drained off. Charity Farm has a pond.Redcastle Farm has four.
